trans-unit.source: Monitor background task progress and completion
trans-unit.target: Monitor background task progress and completion

trans-unit.source: Learn how your app can recognize progress and completion reported by a background task.
trans-unit.target: Learn how your app can recognize progress and completion reported by a background task.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: BackgroundTaskRegistration
trans-unit.target: BackgroundTaskRegistration

trans-unit.source: BackgroundTaskProgressEventHandler
trans-unit.target: BackgroundTaskProgressEventHandler

trans-unit.source: BackgroundTaskCompletedEventHandler
trans-unit.target: BackgroundTaskCompletedEventHandler

trans-unit.source: Learn how your app can recognize progress and completion reported by a background task.
trans-unit.target: Learn how your app can recognize progress and completion reported by a background task.

trans-unit.source: Background tasks are decoupled from the app, and they run separately, but background task progress and completion can be monitored by app code.
trans-unit.target: Background tasks are decoupled from the app, and they run separately, but background task progress and completion can be monitored by app code.

trans-unit.source: To make this happen, the app subscribes to events from the background task(s) it has registered with the system.
trans-unit.target: To make this happen, the app subscribes to events from the background task(s) it has registered with the system.

trans-unit.source: This topic assumes that you have an app that registers background tasks.
trans-unit.target: This topic assumes that you have an app that registers background tasks.

trans-unit.source: To get started quickly building a background task, see [Create and register a background task](create-and-register-a-background-task.md).
trans-unit.target: To get started quickly building a background task, see [Create and register a background task](create-and-register-a-background-task.md).

trans-unit.source: For more in-depth information on conditions and triggers, see [Support your app with background tasks](support-your-app-with-background-tasks.md).
trans-unit.target: For more in-depth information on conditions and triggers, see [Support your app with background tasks](support-your-app-with-background-tasks.md).

trans-unit.source: Create an event handler to handle completed background tasks
trans-unit.target: Create an event handler to handle completed background tasks

trans-unit.source: Create an event handler function to handle completed background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Create an event handler function to handle completed background tasks.

trans-unit.source: This code needs to follow a specific footprint, which takes in an [**IBackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224803) object and a [**BackgroundTaskCompletedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224778) object.
trans-unit.target: This code needs to follow a specific footprint, which takes in an [**IBackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224803) object and a [**BackgroundTaskCompletedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224778) object.

trans-unit.source: Use the following footprint for the OnCompleted background task event handler method:
trans-unit.target: Use the following footprint for the OnCompleted background task event handler method:

trans-unit.source: Add code to the event handler that deals with the background task completion.
trans-unit.target: Add code to the event handler that deals with the background task completion.

trans-unit.source: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) updates the UI.
trans-unit.target: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) updates the UI.

trans-unit.source: Create an event handler function to handle background task progress
trans-unit.target: Create an event handler function to handle background task progress

trans-unit.source: Create an event handler function to handle completed background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Create an event handler function to handle completed background tasks.

trans-unit.source: This code needs to follow a specific footprint, which takes in an [**IBackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224803) object and a [**BackgroundTaskProgressEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224782) object:
trans-unit.target: This code needs to follow a specific footprint, which takes in an [**IBackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224803) object and a [**BackgroundTaskProgressEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224782) object:

trans-unit.source: Use the following footprint for the OnProgress background task event handler method:
trans-unit.target: Use the following footprint for the OnProgress background task event handler method:

trans-unit.source: Add code to the event handler that deals with the background task completion.
trans-unit.target: Add code to the event handler that deals with the background task completion.

trans-unit.source: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) updates the UI with the progress status passed in via the *args* parameter:
trans-unit.target: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) updates the UI with the progress status passed in via the *args* parameter:

trans-unit.source: ```cs private void OnProgress(IBackgroundTaskRegistration task, BackgroundTaskProgressEventArgs args) { var progress = "Progress: " + args.Progress + "%"; BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskProgress = progress;
trans-unit.target: ```cs private void OnProgress(IBackgroundTaskRegistration task, BackgroundTaskProgressEventArgs args) { var progress = "Progress: " + args.Progress + "%"; BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskProgress = progress;

trans-unit.source: Register the event handler functions with new and existing background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Register the event handler functions with new and existing background tasks.

trans-unit.source: When the app registers a background task for the first time, it should register to receive progress and completion updates for it, in case the task runs while the app is still active in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: When the app registers a background task for the first time, it should register to receive progress and completion updates for it, in case the task runs while the app is still active in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) calls the following function on each background task that it registers:
trans-unit.target: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) calls the following function on each background task that it registers:

trans-unit.source: ```cpp void SampleBackgroundTask::AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(IBackgroundTaskRegistration^ task) { auto progress = [this](BackgroundTaskRegistration^ task, BackgroundTaskProgressEventArgs^ args) { auto progress = "Progress: " + args->Progress + "%"; BackgroundTaskSample::SampleBackgroundTaskProgress = progress; UpdateUI(); };
trans-unit.target: ```cpp void SampleBackgroundTask::AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(IBackgroundTaskRegistration^ task) { auto progress = [this](BackgroundTaskRegistration^ task, BackgroundTaskProgressEventArgs^ args) { auto progress = "Progress: " + args->Progress + "%"; BackgroundTaskSample::SampleBackgroundTaskProgress = progress; UpdateUI(); };

trans-unit.source: When the app launches, or navigates to a new page where background task status is relevant, it should get a list of background tasks currently registered and associate them with the progress and completion event handler functions.
trans-unit.target: When the app launches, or navigates to a new page where background task status is relevant, it should get a list of background tasks currently registered and associate them with the progress and completion event handler functions.

trans-unit.source: The list of background tasks currently registered by the application is kept in the [**BackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224786).[**AllTasks**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224787) property.
trans-unit.target: The list of background tasks currently registered by the application is kept in the [**BackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224786).[**AllTasks**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224787) property.

trans-unit.source: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) uses the following code to attach event handlers when the SampleBackgroundTask page is navigated to:
trans-unit.target: For example, the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666) uses the following code to attach event handlers when the SampleBackgroundTask page is navigated to:

trans-unit.source: ```cs protected override void OnNavigatedTo(NavigationEventArgs e) { foreach (var task in BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks) { if (task.Value.Name == BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName) { AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(task.Value); BackgroundTaskSample.UpdateBackgroundTaskStatus(BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName, true); } }
trans-unit.target: ```cs protected override void OnNavigatedTo(NavigationEventArgs e) { foreach (var task in BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks) { if (task.Value.Name == BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName) { AttachProgressAndCompletedHandlers(task.Value); BackgroundTaskSample.UpdateBackgroundTaskStatus(BackgroundTaskSample.SampleBackgroundTaskName, true); } }
